result.execSummary:
The defendant Kody L.K. Grimm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(d).
  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with B.B., her residence or her family
Not to use/possess any alcohol
Not to enter any place whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
Not to use/possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

Complete sex offender evaluation and follow through with programming
Comply with sex offender registry.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Same conditions as Count 1
Concurrent with: Count 1

Postconviction Motion Hearing, July 18, 2018
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED: that the defendant's post-conviction motion requesting a new jury trial is denied as stated at the post-conviction motion hearing held on 7/18/18.
Order re: Motion for Postconviction Relief

9:01am - Defendant Kody L.K. Grimm appears via video conference from Jackson Correctional. Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appears in Court.  Meri C. Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense calls G.S. to the stand- sworn and testifies. Cross by State. Re-direct by Defense. Witness excused. Defense calls T.O. via telephone conference from the Dunn County Jail - sworn and testifies. Cross by State. Defense calls S.T. to the stand - sworn and testifies. Arguments by counsel. Court rules that Defense motion for Ineffective Assistance of Counsel is denied. Motion for post conviction relief based on judicial authority denied. State asks that Exhibit 1 be sealed by Court. Defense has no objection. Court grants States Motion to Seal. State to provide copy to Defense of Exhibit 1.
Defendant's Supplemental Motion for Postconviction Relief
Defense request for reconsideration for post-conviction hearing and ruling
IT IS ORDERED: Defendant's Motion for post-conviction relief is summarily denied.
Tyler Olson
Sierra Thompson-Stowzewski
Gary Smith
